consultations.summary: Patient presents with progressive dyspnea on exertion, decreased rescue inhaler efficacy. BP 152/86. COPD exacerbation suspected.

soapNote.subjective: Patient reports worsening breathlessness over the past 2 weeks. Increased use of salbutamol inhaler with reduced effect. Denies fever or chest pain. Past history of COPD diagnosed 3 years ago.
soapNote.objective: BP 152/86 mmHg, HR 92 bpm, SpO2 94% on room air. Chest: diffuse expiratory wheeze bilaterally. Accessory muscle use noted.
soapNote.assessment: COPD exacerbation (J44.1) with concurrent hypertension (I10). Rescue inhaler efficacy reduced — consider step-up therapy.
soapNote.plan: Increase budesonide/formoterol to high-dose. Add short course oral prednisolone 40mg for 5 days. Review in 1 week or sooner if worsening. Spirometry booked.

consultations.summary: Follow-up for type 2 diabetes and hypertension. HbA1c 7.8%. Medication adjustment discussed, metformin dose increased.

soapNote.subjective: Patient reports occasional post-prandial blood sugar spikes. No hypoglycaemic episodes. BP controlled on current medication. Diet largely compliant.
soapNote.objective: BP 134/84 mmHg. Weight 82 kg (stable). HbA1c 7.8% (target <7%). FBS 142 mg/dL.
soapNote.assessment: Type 2 diabetes (E11) — suboptimal glycaemic control. Hypertension (I10) — adequately controlled on current regimen.
soapNote.plan: Increase metformin to 1g BD. Add sitagliptin 50mg OD. Lifestyle counselling reinforced. Repeat HbA1c in 3 months.

consultations.summary: Asthma follow-up. Symptoms well-controlled on current regimen. Peak flow 380 L/min. Advised to continue budesonide.

soapNote.subjective: Patient reports good asthma control over past 3 months. No nocturnal symptoms. No emergency visits. Using preventer inhaler regularly.
soapNote.objective: PEFR 380 L/min (85% predicted). Lungs clear on auscultation. No accessory muscle use.
soapNote.assessment: Asthma (J45.20) — well controlled. Continue current therapy.
soapNote.plan: Continue budesonide 200 mcg BD. Reinforce correct inhaler technique. Review in 6 months or PRN.

consultations.summary: Acute bronchitis. Productive cough for 5 days. Afebrile. Chest clear. No antibiotics indicated at this time.

soapNote.subjective: Productive cough for 5 days, yellow sputum. No fever. Mild sore throat. No dyspnoea. No sick contacts.
soapNote.objective: Temperature 37.1°C. Chest clear to auscultation. No wheeze or crackles.
soapNote.assessment: Acute bronchitis (J20.9) — likely viral. No features warranting antibiotic therapy.
soapNote.plan: Supportive management: adequate fluids, steam inhalation, honey-based lozenges. Review if fever develops or symptoms persist beyond 10 days.

consultations.summary: Colon polyp follow-up. Colonoscopy result reviewed. No new polyps identified. Repeat in 3 years recommended.

soapNote.subjective: Patient reports no GI symptoms. Colonoscopy performed last week — no new polyps found. Previous tubular adenoma removed 3 years ago.
soapNote.objective: Abdomen soft, non-tender. No masses palpable. Colonoscopy report: normal mucosa, no polyps.
soapNote.assessment: History of colonic polyp (K63.5) — currently clear on surveillance colonoscopy.
soapNote.plan: Routine surveillance colonoscopy in 3 years. High-fibre diet advised. No medications changed.

clinicalInsights.title: Summary
clinicalInsights.body: Patient seen for diabetes follow-up. Reports stable fasting sugars with occasional post-prandial spikes. No hypoglycemic events.

clinicalInsights.title: Assessment
clinicalInsights.body: Type 2 diabetes, HTN — controlled. Consider reviewing dose timing and nutrition counseling.

clinicalInsights.title: Plan
clinicalInsights.body: Adjust evening dose timing, order A1c, and schedule nutrition consult in 2 weeks.
